meanings.definition: To make or become Italian in character, culture, or style.
meanings.sent1: She tried to italianize her pasta dish by adding traditional Italian spices.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant decided to italianize their menu by including classic Italian dishes.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally italianized his outfit by wearing the colors of the Italian flag.
meanings.sent4: The small town was slowly italianizing as more Italian immigrants moved in.
meanings.sent5: The music festival aimed to italianize the event by featuring Italian musicians.

meanings.definition: To give an Italian form or character to.
meanings.sent1: The artist wanted to italianize the painting by using techniques from Italian art.
meanings.sent2: The architect chose to italianize the building with columns and arches reminiscent of Italian architecture.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator accidentally italianized the cake by using the colors of the Italian flag.
meanings.sent4: Her love for Italian culture italianized her home, filled with Italian art and furniture.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer sought to italianize her collection by drawing inspiration from Italian fashion trends.
